Course schedules

The module Macroecology and global change offers one lecture on Macroecology and two practical courses on Macroecological analyses and on Species distribution modelling, which are run in sequence.

Schedule for the winter term 2021/2022

Week Lecture (Tuesdays, 90 min) Practicals (Thursdays, 180 min)
1 (Oct 25th - Oct 29th) What is macroecology ?
  1. Macroecological analyses
  1. Spatial data in R
2 Global biodiversity patterns I
  1. Species richness gradients
3 Global biodiversity patterns II
  1. Species richness regression
4 Limits to species distributions I
  1. Species range maps
5 Limits to species distributions II
  1. Species threats + 6. Biodiversity changes
6 Drivers of biodiversity change
  1. Species distribution modelling
  1. Species data + 2. Environmental data
7 Observed biodiversity change - terrerstrial
  1. SDM I: simple model fitting + 4. SDM II: model assessment and prediction
8 (Dec 13th - Dec 17th) Observed biodiversity change - marine & freshwater
  1. Pseudo-absence and background data
9 (Jan 3rd - Jan 7th) Modelling biodiversity dynamics I
  1. SDM III: algorithms
10 Modelling biodiversity dynamics II
  1. SDM IV: ensembles
11 Scientific writing Group work
12 Components of diversity
13 Functional traits
14 tbd
15 (Feb 14th - Feb 18th) Q&A Presentations
